availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: I Edward Goodman of the town and County of Hartford and State of Connecticut having been appointed by the governor of the State of Connecticut Kentucky commissioner of deeds to execute and fulfil the duties of the said office within the State of Connecticut do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of said office

State of Connecticut
Hartford County ss Hartford February 10 1862
Personally appeared the above named Edward Goodman and made oath that he would well and truly execute and perform the duties of the office mentioned in the above certificate by time indicated

Connecticut
Oath of Edwd. Goodman
Comr. of Deeds
Filed Feby 22. 1862
